posts.com:
Welcome to /x/ - Paranormal. This is not a board for the faint of heart. If you need something to get started with, see the below lists for some basic resources. We hope you enjoy your venture into the spooks, the creeps and the unknown.

The resources in this thread are not exhaustive and are merely meant for beginners to get their footing.

posts.com:

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Please note the following:

• This board desires high quality discussion. High quality posts will be praised. Low quality posts e.g. "Is this paranormal?" or "I am [insert paranormal entity here] ask me anything," etc. will be removed.
• Requests belong on >>>/wsr/.
• Conspiracy theories are welcome, but anything political in nature should be posted to >>>/pol/.
• For everything else, refer to global and board-specific rules.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Psyop Edition

>Who is the Nobody?
Nobody is just a guy alive today. He is many things; all of them are nothing that you couldn't have guessed. He is also the inventor of some gubbmint secret stuff and is the only human-being alive whom the department of energy has the slightest bit of respect for, he believes.

Nobody has a successful business in secondhand succubi. This may be due to his discovery of a dimension where succubi escape to. If so, he employed an anon to sit in this now empty dimension denying the whole thing.

Grey ayys think he's really nice.

He's just like you, but he has found the kingdom of God within himself through sheer dedication, just like you will. He isn't a savior; remember that it's you who creates your own reality. With your hands, thoughts, feelings, words, you are the creator of your story. No one can decide your fate except for you and God. Remember your right to power, to step up into your ultimate role as your highest self, should you choose to embark on that journey.

>What is the general picture?
It’s important we start replying more to the good posters and educating the hateful ones, so call upon their heads the forces of Heaven for peace, clarity, and wisdom. None of us are perfect, it is by learning to admit and accept this fact one is able to learn, and grow in Truth. Heaven for all is real. The only motive is love.

If this is your first time here, just remember, it’s going to be ok, you may take shelter and find rest. If you are confused, you are paying attention.

So manifest the guy you imagined then, why this fixation on this person in particular? If the man in your head is better, just manifest the better man. I have seen this with people in relationships already too, trying to manifest their gf/bf to be "better", just manifest yourself in the perfect relationship and see what happens, don't try to force it upon a specific person. Doing people you know is challenging because your biases are already fully formed, it takes a huge amount of effort to unstick those mental habits about them, it can make it difficult to want to be with them knowing their present 3D situation is just so different from what you really want.

I mean if you want to fuck him just focus on that and forget the rest, don't overthink it. If you want to truly be with him you need to ask yourself if it is even possible to want to be with him in his current state, and if it is worth your time and energy and effort overcoming your existing biases against him instead of just letting the perfect man (evidently not him) come to you. You also need to overcome your own personal biases against yourself that you see within him, do you doubt you're "his type"? Do you doubt you can keep his attention? Do you believe he might cheat on you? All of these doubts can be very challenging to overcome, it is almost always better just to imagine the better man, not the man himself.

I know it can be hard, but imagine the person you want the most, but they are even better, and you want them even more. THAT is who you want.

I think Murphy would say to visualize the butterfly first, and then use affirmations to be grateful for it, or hear voices talking about seeing the butterfly (ex. "Wow, what a pretty butterfly", "That's a lovely color", etc.). Pic related is from the "Practical Techniques in Mental Healings" chapter of "The Power of Your Subconscious Mind".

If you're still deadset on just affirmations, you might get better help if you give more details. For instance, how exactly did you phrase your affirmation for seeing the golden butterfly? Also, what were your affirmations and results for the other "larger" manifestations that you did?

Off the top of my head, the "Wealth" chapter in PoYSM gives some troubleshooting for affirming, even though it's wealth focused.

>What gives? And, as a side question, are there other resources for learning the process of affirming?
The works of Florence Scovel Shinn will probably be up your alley if you like Joseph Murphy. They're in the Library in the OP, with "The Game of Life" being her most popular work.

I'll give a few principles that probably weren't taught by Joseph Murphy, or if they were, then I'll elaborate a bit more.
>"I AM" is actually a magical formula in itself, in that it's God name according to the story of Moses. So when you say "I AM" or even "I'm", you are invoking God, and casting a blessing (or curse) on yourself. For affirming, add an emotional adjective with that phrase, like "I am glad that ____" or "I am grateful for _____", and so on. For cautionary measures, cut out negative statements that start with "I am", like "I am sick of _____" or "I am so fed up with ____".

>Never say "if", because that suggests that things might go in a way that you don't want it to. This is a tip from Neville.

>Murphy mentions these, but just a reminder, use past tense, and show gratitude. These are Biblical techniques to remove doubt, and to remember to trust the subconscious first instead of coming up with conscious ideas.

Okay, I guess what I was trying to ask about your past affirmations was basically, have you done any that were similar, in terms of descriptions or anything?

What I mean is that in terms of divine mind, there is no "large" or "small" manifestation, what matters is how well you communicate that to your subconscious. So you might've scripted an event with a girl, but did you already know that girl? If so, then your mind already has an image and idea of that girl. What I'm asking is have you ever done something like "I've met a red-haired girl with long curly hair, and gorgeous blue eyes, with a slightly deep but sexy voice, etc.", or described something like "I drive around in a comfortable black car, that gets all my neighbors jealous, blah blah blah".

Like, have your previous affirmations ever been about something vague that you fill in the blanks for with a bunch of descriptors (like this butterfly would be), or were they all involving something you already had clear concepts about (as in people you know, objects that you have a good idea about, and so on).

At the end of the day, what's happening is that your subconscious isn't getting the message, or you have counteracting beliefs about seeing the butterfly. So the two ways to go about that would be to give a clearer message to your mind (look up pictures of a golden butterfly to give a better idea of what you want), but with that off the table, you would probably better off "building your way up" to a golden butterfly. I know you think that's a low bar already, but just try with different "small" objects. Like see if you can get a candle first, then a specific color candle like green, and so on. Or you could even do that with butterflies too, like just any butterfly, and then narrow the detail down after that.

>>33693119
>subliminal yt videos in general?
They can be very good, as long as you recognize the limits of what subliminals can do, and what they should do.
If you have limiting beliefs, like "people hate hate, people ignore you, you are uncofident, you are ugly, etc", subliminals can do a great job re-writing those.
They can also have strange niche magical effects, like manifesting finding lost items, or speeding shipping times, and healing family relationships.
But if they are relied on too much, they can make someone an absolute delusional weirdo. Andrew Tate would an example of someone like this IMO. If he wasn't getting some glowniggers propping him up with fame, he would just be some creeper working a dead-beat job, with subliminals programming him to think he is something he is not, so people will laugh at his delusions, and he will get backlash for it.

Subliminals can be used for good or evil. And they should be used in a balanced way, not expecting them to fix every problem in your life.
So you have to know their limits, and when subliminals are a good solution - and when they are not.

>spaceship video
I have no idea something like that would turn out, but maybe you will pick up a new video game hobby that allows those things to manifest.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33693680
>I've read the Psalms, there's nothing there but the emotional impact people get
Fairy tales are not allegories for your relationship with the subconscious and superconscious minds. The Psalms are not just feel-good songs, they're considered a spellbook for many centuries because they're constructed with magical formulas in how to think about God and how to overcome problems in your life.

Like, just give this a watch (you can skip to 13:26 to get into the Psalm right away)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4OPImxfMbQ8

Do you really think that your mind would be jogged in anyway near the same way from a Dictionary?

>I've researched how the bible was written
First off, you probably don't know how the Psalms were written. I'm not saying that I do either, because there's no definitive proof for the origin of them. It's likely that they were actually a bunch of spells from a bunch of different kinds of communities like Christians, Egyptian mages, the Chaldeans, mages and witches of other sorts, and then compiled by the Christians when the written Bible was being made.
>the original Psalms didn't even say what's written in in english.
This is actually a problem for a handful of words (in the video example above, "meek" is mentioned to actually mean "well-trained", and "wrath" in the same Psalm also has a wrong connotation in English where it should probably just be "strong emotion"). Still, the core concepts and the imagery remains, and that's what matters beyond language.

There's a reason why Neville studied and interpreted the Bible so fervently. There's a reason why Jesus quoted the Psalms the most. There's a wisdom in those books that can teach you more than other books can.

You're under the impression that because you can technically manifest and train your mind in any which way, that anything can get you equal results. That's not the case at all. It's like weight training, where different weights give you different results or rates of progress.

posts.name: Pachad
posts.com:
>>33678542
>synchronous in time
Not necessarily. I'll admit that the ideal probably looks like a bunch of people in the same physical place and time, but you could get several people working towards a specific goal even if at different times. Especially if astrological timing is necessary and the operators are far enough apart.

I think it may have been in Dion Fortune's Psychic Self Defence, but I remember reading an anecdote that an individual reported meeting another practitioner on the astral prior to their agreed upon time for their group astral projection. Obviously that's to be taken with a heap of salt, but I've certainly experienced weirdness with time before impactful operations. Things like experiencing the effects of a ritual before it's actually performed.

>clarity of intent
Yes.

>simple goal
Not necessarily. If only because highly specific goals can be challenging even for a sole practitioner.

>benevolent goals like guidance for humanity
Sure, if you want. But that's extremely vague and generally hard to track, if admirable nonetheless. Plus, you'll have a hard time influencing literally all of humanity. A group working done by something like a lodge, with a goal relevant specifically to that lodge (or coven, cult, or whatever) seems more ideal.

>what to read
The topic is general enough that I don't think there's any one book that treats it specifically. Group work is the kind of thing that would get mentioned briefly or in passing.

>>33679266
Depends which ethical system you are following.
From a Jewish perspective, it would probably go something like the following:
>honey jar spells are sorcery which is forbidden
>in constrast stage magic and illusions are a permissible form of magic, provided you let people know it is an illusion
>you are also allowed to do magic for the purposes of personal spiritual development
>One Rabbi has commented it is probably okay to petition the heavens for your desires, however the heavens will probably take away a blessing from somewhere else if they give you desire, because the world is created with justice so petitioning the heavens is not a free cheat code to life, and God sees the bigger picture, so it's probably not worthwhile to do it to much
>however you are allowed to sin if you can deal with the consequences (ie severe judgements in response to sin, that the Old Testament is completely filled with examples of)
>the consequences for a honey jar probably wouldn't be that severe if your intent is pure, such as to restore a friendship that had grown cold.
>if the intent of the honey jar spell was impure, there could be much more severe consequences. Like if you bind someone in love against their will, a similar thing could happen to you, where you are forced in a relationship with someone you are not attracted to, and feel you lose years of your life and willpower in a situation like that.
>there are general curses against sorcery that are listed in the Old Testament. So even if you aren't actively harming others, still the heavens may decide to send some curses on you, and especially notable will be the curse of social isolation. However for one honey jar spell this might not kick in, but if you keep dabbling in magic it probably would at some point.

In Judaism it's a big ethical can of worms. The main thing to worry about is that if you harm someone else or restrict their freewill, you will likely be punished "eye for an eye", and no free lunch

There is a tier to celibacy:
>physical sexual sins: things like adultery and illegal types of sex, that are explicitedly prohibited in the Old Testament,
>mental sexual sins: Jesus says that to even look at a woman with lust is to commit adultery with her. There are similar teachings in Kabbalah and Eastern meditation systems. Watching porn would fall under this category, where the main person it harms is yourself.
>Semen Loss: Teachings in Kabbalah, as well as some yoga and meditation gurus, consider semen loss to be the worst sin, as it is typically the biggest thing preventing a man from rapid spiritual development. posts.name: The Ape of
posts.com:
>>33690115
Yes, researching the Bornless One, depends on your level of skill/precise needs, Brill has a compilation of Greek Temple Law if you wanna do the purity stricture rigamarole and uh Coming Forth by Day has a variety of spells - like really you can accompany any given rite with any Hellenic/Egyptian/Near Eastern mystical devotion and get some utility out of it you just gotta know who/where/how/why. Get as much as you can for the exact instructions. Wing what you can't. Your general ritual items (wand cup, etc) are handy but not EXACTLY needed for this but again they're handy.

I have a lot of thoughts on the precise operations of Lemegeton - the scripts are like super lightweight it's the items that can bog you down but really I think folks have a ton more flexibility than they realize when they start - paint a white bedsheet for your circle, dowel rods can work for a rod until one falls on your lap. You can make an easy mirror or, more historically, use a bucket as a brazier. Metal plates can be acid etched at home with a marker and some decent acid. And yeah you can do things outdoors with relatively minimal setup once you practice a bit.

My general stance is: "Every (historical/reconstructionist) rite you do should go as close as possible to the original script(s) THAT IS REASONABLE for you to accomplish. Milk crates and a cloth or something hopefully more sturdy etc., etc., etc.

Each semester is six months, each package is one semester. I suppose one could simply go off on their own and simply apply for exams, but then it'd beg the question why they're even bothering with IMBOLC when all AA grade examinations are completely free from a superior, and available online for the aspirant to test themselves.

Let's take a look what you get all in with package C, at a whopping €748 for six months:

-One (1) email per week for study support.
-Teaching Letters (pre written knowledge lectures, I suppose).
-questions and exercises to do (homework).
-84 "libelli" and libri across the three levels (assuming each level doesn't include the previous level's libelli, which would mean 48 all in).
-an IMBOLC email address
-book review mp3s
-pdf library with 20k books (no doubt in the world that Ape's library ITT contains rarer material, given that Ape, myself, and others have contributed never before scanned material).
-digital media like podcasts, videos, "inspirations", audios, and pictures

Jumping up to €1328 for a six month semester, you get "exclusive personal support" from their founder, with not so much as a lineage of masters to point to for legitimacy.

But I really question what this "exclusive personal support" entails, given that only at the final package for €1825 do you get one (1) weekly Skype with the so-called master, and a private curriculum. Meaning that the previous package doesn't even give you so much as a Skype call once a week.

If we see that the first package entails getting one email a week got €378, you need to pay an additional €1447 to upgrade to a fucking Skype call.

>Bronze Age Collapse
Actually somewhat mysterious but the truth is that there probably is no silver bullet on this, just a confluence of factors and explanations any one of which, or all of them, may be true in some capacity. In any case spasms of human migration washed over Europe and Asia in this period. I'm a strong fan of "Cretan exiles/refugees" and the Nuragic theories of the Sea Peoples.

>Atlantis
Mix; lots of dumb shit with interesting material. Could be an ancient memory of Doggerland. Could be a late paleolithic city on the west side of the Iberian. The Richat Structure is mega fuckin' goofy as a potential Atlantis. Fieldwork out there has never turned out anything other than some lithics. Habitation looks minimal for all archaeohistorical evidence and the area shows zero of the markers for "recent port" or "complex monumental culture".

>Giants
Huge amounts of the worst grainy photoshops and Smithsonian reports from the infancy of paleontology. The US archaeology communities are so widely distributed that it's pretty much impossible that the Smithson's hiding a big vault of literal giants - most archaeology departments in a university can't keep "which professor is sleeping with which grad student" a secret so idk why folks think they're capable of hiding a whole ass race of giants.

>con't

>Mud floods and Tartaria
Tartaria is one of the weirdest fringe bullshit I've ever seen derriving ultimately from Fomenko's "new chronology" which has been BTFO at every turn. Folks see "Tartaria" on a map and have a meltdown because they don't know the history of geography. Zero geological or stratigraphical evidence of a global flood, let alone one of a mud variety, and even then, archaeometrics, strata dating, tree ring dating, etc., etc,. would be able to bear out the true age of any of this stuff, which just doesn't exist in our knowledge base. Like...every state has an archive of archaeological reports that are created for some of the most anodyne construction projects, i.e. road realignments, and nothing like this has ever been seen in those reports. Again, the field is distributed enough that keeping an ancient mud flooded tartarian monumental civilization secret would be orders of magnitude beyond "faking the moon landing". Even then the cavities created by hollows rotted out from the mud should be relatively easily detected on GPR and we just don't see those kinds of disturbances.

>>>Actual stuff that gets the gears of a pro archaeologist/historian turning:
Gobekli Tepe
Amazonian complex civ/geoglyphs
Issyk-Kul civilization
Meso/South American evidence of human habitation before ~15k ya
Doggerland, already mentioned
"Stonehenge of the Amazon" in Ampa
Saharan riverways
Patterns of karst habitation in north america
Patterns of habitation near/in the Gobi
Pretty much all of North Afghanistan/Oxus
etc

You don't have to adhere to the most "mainstream" narratives, but boy you sure don't have to waste your time on unmedicated fever dreams.

>Atlantis
Atlantis wasn't just a single city, it was an entire global civilization that existed prior to the Younger Dryas Impact which cause great cataclysm on the Earth, ended the ice age and resulted in a sea level rise of about 400 feet. >>33687316
That's true. For years I was pointlessly gloomy, even though things had gotten better. Dragging others into that was just a feeble attempt to prolong my pain. But I had desentisised so much that I was starting to lose sight of what's positive and what's negative. And in fact, that's subjective to the point that not even Lilith could tell me what I "should" want.

When I made a wish 8 years ago, I was already deeply in conflict with myself. My teachers said with my talents, I could be anything I wanted. But with a mind broken by loneliness, all I could long for anymore was to be a loving man's housewife. And such a meagre sense of normality seemed so far out of reach, that I was even willing to "sell my soul" for it, offering up everything I valued and believed in.

But Lilith didn't allow that. She granted my wish without taking anything in return, confronting me with an obvious question: "So, what do you want next?" And thus, I began to question myself: "Why did I think I wanted to be such a normal person? In the first place, wasn't I just arrogant for thinking I wasn't?" Perhaps on some level, I began to wonder if the great depths of sorrow and pain I'd overcome were all that truly set me apart. Upon further reflection, it became apparent that I had already begun to think of people's foregone despair as the essence of who I truly am deep down. And who was to say that it can't be? It clearly shaped my development as a person tremendously.

Yet, the shallow wish I'd once made came from the bottom of my heart nonetheless. I finally understood why Mother Lilith hugs me so often: no matter what kind of path one may be on, it's always better with company. And in understanding that, I began to remember what my true will once was, in the absence of boredom and despair:
I want to make people happy.

The difference lies only in what I choose to do. I've decided to embody the ideals I perceive in those I admire, in a way that is both healthy and sustainable.

>>33696588
Thinking about anything directs energy towards that thing and will eventually cause it to manifest. However, the amount of energy in a random thought is not enough to evoke a demon. It requires sustained focus and often tools to amplify that focus, such as talismans, crystals, or the combined efforts of multiple summoners.

To invoke a demon is to cause its form to coalesce into the physical plane. Few can achieve this. I myself have only found success doing so when performing rituals with a group of at least 5 others. For the uninitiated who take part in these rituals, merely the power emanating from an otherworldly entity has caused them to collapse. They then awaken hours later as someone completely different. But this is why we perform the summoning as a group. Should one of us fall, the others remain to keep the being sealed before it causes more harm.

Now, to interact with a demon is akin to feeling its presence or hearing its whisper. It's far easier to accomplish this alone, and can even occur inadvertently during our lifetimes. Mediums have a knack for interacting with spirits, for example, but you won't ever see them forcing one to manifest. It's too much for one human alone to accomplish, and even if they could somehow, they would definitely be beyond one's control.

>>33680960
Very good questions. What you've seen is the trap of materialism. It's the error that arises when trying to define spiritual concepts based on physicality.

If you go down that road, it leads to slavery. For example, a murderer could put a gun to a hostages head and say
>I'll only kill this person if you don't give me money
Now what happens if nobody pays him so he shoots the hostage? Are we all "guilty" for that persons death?
Or similarly look at the classic "trolley problem".

The only solution to those puzzles I've ever found, and the thing which makes the most sense, is that "guilt" is defined by what's INSIDE you. Your intention.
The murderer created the un-winnable situation from his negative intentions. So no matter the outcome the guilt belongs to him and nobody else.

So to answer your question about eating meat, the answer is what your intentions are.
Do you eat meat because you like the idea of consuming the flesh of living things, while dominating them as a superior predator?
Or do you only do it because you "have to", while perhaps wishing there was an easier way to avoid it, because you do in fact still care about animals?

I would say only the 1st one is guilty of being "evil".
The 2nd one is just being caught in an un-winnable situation designed by someone else (and the world), and in my book is not "evil" at all.

>Is eating meat evil?
Is using the definition that "evil is the forces of destruction", then obviously eating meat is evil, because it caused an animal to die.

>is it a necessary evil?
Yes it turns out that many vegans babies die, so humans need some animal products, just as carnivores are born to eat meat.

>is it an allowable evil?
In terms of the greater good, it is better than some animals suffer, than humans suffer and be stunted in their health.

For Abrahamics, generally there is no punishment for eating meat.
And Laws of Manu say that eating meat is the natural way of created beings, and so there is no punishment for it, although there may be spiritual benefits to abstaining.

>>33680960
>Is eating meat evil? Thousands of insects die to make vegan food too, is that also evil? If a forest was cut down to plant a farm and hundreds of animals lost their home, am I evil for buying vegetables in the store that came from that farm?
Are you willing to live the life you gave the animals, or not?
Honestly, I think that's all there is to it.
Living a life in a cage, only being allowed to walk around a little, having parts of your body cut off. It's a shitty way to live, I don't want to do that to others, I don't want it done to me.

But, on the other hand, a free range chicken with a bunch of room, with all the space to perform all it's normal instinctual behaviors...That's probably fine, for the most part. I would be fine with that life, especially if it was short and the death mostly painless.
Also, how about hunting?
Well, would I be happy living a life as a deer? Dying to a wolf?
Is that a "game" or "incarnation" I would be fine with? Dying relatively quickly? It's not like a prey animal suffers for months, not usually anyway.
Yeah, I'd be fine with that. That's fine.

So really I think what it comes down to is simple- factory farming is probably evil, since it's a burden we wouldn't put on ourselves, but family farms are probably fine.

For me, I eventually realized I was getting close to "pitying" animals. To avoid pitying them, I think we have to imagine ourselves living their lives. If you are comfortable living the life of a free range chicken, then eat their eggs and flesh. I would not want to be a factory farmed chicken or cow, so I will work towards avoiding that bullshit, it's pretty shitty.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>Is eating meat evil? Thousands of insects die to make vegan food too, is that also evil? If a forest was cut down to plant a farm and hundreds of animals lost their home, am I evil for buying vegetables in the store that came from that farm?

Your question is flawed. Most vegans like myself don't even necessarily think in such simplistic moralistic terms like "evil". In my case, I was someone who was raised in an omnivore culture and socialised into eating animal flesh in various forms without questioning it, and I enjoyed it. Because of modern mass industrial agriculture I'd never even seen an animal raised for slaughter. At some stage I made a mental, logical, emotional connection between eating this meat and the reality of the experience of animals who die for that food. Then I told myself that those animals probably lived pretty decent happy lives on farms and so on until a sudden and pretty painless death. At some stage, though, I looked into it and found that this isn't true - it's much more awful than any of that. It's simple empathy. I don't want others hurting or enslaving me. I wouldn't like someone firing a bolt-pistol into my brains, and my flesh being used for someone elses pleasure. Most of us are aware that humans transitioning to a different diet would involve lots of changes, and that there are moral issues including issue relating to the suffering of animals displaced by farming or insects killed in the production of food, etc. What we're doing is the most simple first step possible - we're saying "I won't eat any of this", sometimes we do this as I originally did, thinking that others would follow and that I'd send 'signals' through consumer culture so that the world would change - and this definitely did happen to some degree, many of us just want like the idea of participating in it, even if we feel things won't change. Many anti-vegan posters think they have a 'gotcha' moment with these questions, as if we aren't aware of them.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33684004
Continuing...

The vegan diet still impacts animals, there is no debating this, it impacts in many many ways. Even when vegan food items are shipped anywhere, animals end up being killed as roadkill by those delivery trucks. Animals are affected constantly, in every little way. But the simplest point is that if anything is going to change, stopping killing highly complex animals like cows, pigs, and so on - who are clearly capable of not just sentience but high levels of intelligence, emotion, affection, fear, etc. I personally try to avoid killing insects but I would consider it a significantly worse thing to willfully kill a pig than even maybe many insects. This involves judgement and knowledge about what sentient and experience is, and all sorts of factors we can't claim to definitively know, but for the same reason most people wouldn't want to kidnap a human child and kill them, we don't want cows or pigs or chickens being treated so brutally or killed for their flesh, especially when it's not necessary.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33684019
The issue is mostly RELATIVE HARM. Humans have to survive, and we impact the environment and other animals. Is it so unreasonable to say that we should try to MINIMISE this harm and suffering? That's what vegans are doing. No matter what you argue - producing food for a vegan diet would never have to impact as many lives, and especially wouldn't have to affect highly complex animals capable of greater levels of suffering. Also most of these anti-vegan arguments like "Oh rats and small animals are killed by harvesters producing plants for vegans!" are just petty, fake attempts to spin the argument - vegans want to minimise harm, generally farmers kill animals in those ways because they were raised in this omnivore culture that thinks it's justifiable to do so to produce food for humans. If vegans had their way - all vegan food would also be produced in ways that animals aren't killed in the process. This is entirely POSSIBLE, it would just take more effort, and would 'cost' more to the end consumer. This is part of the point vegans are making - that under the current system, animal lives and suffering are reduced to a matter of PROFIT for humans. It shouldn't be that way.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33684027
Now, I'll simply argue assuming your good faith, but generally speaking my experience is that most 'anti-vegans' or those who argue against this stuff aren't arguing or even thinking in good faith, but I'll assume it just so that if anyone does seek the truth - they can benefit. The simple reality is that the present system is incredibly brutal, but mostly concealed from the publics eyes. Sometimes the most innocent beings imaginable - like beautiful little calves or piglets, are torn from the security of their mothers and siblings, put in a terrifying situation like transported on a very noisy, shaking truck, and then killed without sympathy. It's also a statistical inevitability that even if you assume all parties involved are doing their utmost to make it painless (which they aren't), that many animals aren't killed instantly the way they're supposed to, and instead suffer significant head trauma and injuries, in other cases things are much worse - like chickens routinely being improperly beheaded, and then boiled alive. All of this takes place merely so that others can enjoy the pleasure of eating this flesh, and we know that it's not necessary - that we can get all of our nutritional needs without any of this. We can even eat very WELL without this. So the question is, do you want to participate in this? Can you use your imagination and put yourself in the place of these animals? You may have to force yourself, in some ways we don't want to consciously face it - we repress it, we distance ourselves, we rationalise. But ultimately nothing we do changes the reality of that suffering and the ugliness of it all.

>>33687858
I'm a vegan 10 years and I have no known deficiencies. Every major nutritional organisation in the world agrees that an adequately planned vegan diet is more than sufficient to meet all caloric and nutritional requirements, and in many ways is superior to an omni diet. There is literally no mineral or vitamin or aspect of nutrition that we know of that vegans can't easily get directly from plant foods, and we live in a world where plenty of nutritional supplements also exist. If you developed deficiencies, odds are you weren't adequately planning your diet. Now, everyone's body is different, for example some people have real issues with IBS or with gluten intolerance, etc which I can imagine making it harder to be vegan. In most cases, though, there's no reason anyone can't be a full vegan without suffering any deficiencies.

So while I'd like to be sympathetic to your position, the fact that you end your post with "Vegan as just self righteous cope" makes me think you were either never really vegan, or you never really made the slightest effort to eat properly.

I was looking more into the stylized flutes and whistles of Vera Cruz classic culture from around 500 AD trying to put into context their apparent representation of a Lizardman on a flying machine when it became apparent through finding subsequent examples that in some cases it is a female figure that is seated upon the artifact though surrounded by the trappings of the cult of the feathered serpent, my conclusion being that this must represent the sister of Quetzalcoatl, namely Quetzalpetlatl.


In all the images of similar artifacts i've managed to source there is never any information on what is involved, if you're lucky it may be indicated that it is a monster or dragon on top of flute, but really it seems nobody has any idea or has even given any thought as to what is involved.


Yet they should, because otherwise there are no known representations of Quetzalpetlatl and she is only mentioned in the Post-Conquest narrative related on The Death of Quetzalcoatl.

https://pages.ucsd.edu/~dkjordan/nahuatl/ReadingQuetzalcoatl.html

There has always seemed something of an inbalance in the importance of Quetzalcoatl as Venus the Morning star with very little seeming concern with his sister as the Evening star, yet they are seen together

She looks very friendly there and is always seen with her arms outstretched and seemingly welcoming, her suggested associations are with wine and fertility but that's not based on much.

posts.name: Isityche
posts.com:
The name Quetzalpetlatl translates as 'the feather mat', in the mythos that is the only item that the pair are considered to have sat upon regarding the intoxicated downfall of Quetzalcoatl and thus there may be some association with what they are seen sat upon with regards to the flutes, though it doesn't seem much like a mat or to be made of feathers.

But such a mat must have had magical associations and in it's lightness could have been understood as a floating or flying mat, much like the magic carpet tradition, given also the association with the dragon which transported the avatar of the sun God across the Heavens in its jaws this seems likely.

There is also some similarity with Meso-American calendar configurations in the schematics of the artifact they are seated upon which again suggests the Heavenly cosmological aspect.

posts.sub: What does it mean if you radiate blue light?
posts.com:
During the "lockdown" I got bored and was messing around with an OTC that is known to make you trip.

While tripping I went into a completely dark room, blocked out every ounce of light I possibly could, got it as dark as I could manage so I could meditate. However upon completing my dark room, I noticed something weird when I used my walls to get around the room since I couldn't see where I was walking. There was a faint blue light coming off my hand. I got really curious and played around with it for a bit while I was waiting for my eyes to adjust, it was dim but seemed to be bright enough to cast a shadow. I chalked it up to the trip fucking with me.

A week later, I tried the same scenario. Yet again, the faint blue light seemed to be radiating off my body. I took my clothes off and it seemed to be coming from more than just my hand. Again, I chalked it up to a coincidence and it was a side effect of the drug.

Cue three weeks later, bored again so I bust into my stash. I had acclimated more to the dark room and was familiar with getting around as I was regularly meditating there. I decided to see if the light was back, it was, again blue. I brought in some different materials, maybe it was something about my plaster walls creating an illusion. I had a little portable whiteboard, and even that reflected the faint blue light.

What the fuck could be causing this? I don't think there's anything wrong with my eyes, I see fine, but I can't capture it on camera either. I assume it's the drug, but with other psychs I never have repetitive hallucinations like that and the shadow it creates would refute that it's my mind playing tricks on me. I don't think my brain is capable of falsifying perfectly aligning shadows. Again, this room is pitch black, I can't see my hand in front of my face other than when I took this drug.

>>33682928
Yes. The set of numbers between 0 and 1 (or more generally, any infinite set of Real numbers) is a larger infinity than the infinite set of all integers (...-2,-1,0,1,2...).
>0.9999... =/= 1
Since there's no number that separates them one way of looking at it is that they're the same number, but another way of looking at it is that there's an infinite set between them and the infinity of 0.999... approaching 1 is "slower" than the infinity separating the two numbers. At least that's one layman's understanding, been a long time since I read about this and I've definitely simplified parts.

You're on the wrong track, 1/3 can be represented as a fraction while 0.999999... can't be represented as a fraction, it's a limit, the limit of a number approaching 1 from the left. 1/3 and 0.333333... are just different ways of representing the same number, although no one uses the second notation when you can write 1/3. posts.com:
I do this and I still do it. Do I do it right? I don't know. You just surrender. I use meditation techniques, I suppose, I try to be 'present'. I also do a self-hypnotic induction. I cast my intentions, usually to explore the unknown and see what I must see for the benefit of myself and others. Then I just wait. Then something happens. Sometimes it is a glimpse, a rough shape, and all I do is be aware of it. Once I see something, I look, and I follow. Keep your body relaxed to the point that your hands and feet will go to sleep. The gateway tapes can take you to these states of mind and can be useful.

There will come one thing when you wait, one impulse to make you go 'oh. Is this what I was waiting for? What was that?'. You may not like what you see. It may seem dull of inconsequential. This is the point where you need to surrender. This is the feminine quality in you to nurture. Follow it to the end. Try to stay true to the initial energy and don't let your ego pervert it.

I do dialogue sessions with a keyboard and type it up as it happens. I also just lie back and do it, though it is easy to forget what happens.

Keep in mind that what you see or hear in there is not you. You are not that. It is alive and has its own intentions.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33691035
Do you know how to do a hypnotic induction? Go and look that up. It's easy as hell.

Think of a peaceful place in your mind. I have a beach I used to know and a bench at sunset. You need a stairway. I have set mine in the beach. Now . . . go down the stairs. Visualise it. Imagine the sound of the place, the touch of it, the smell, make it really alive with the senses. As you go down those stairs, one at a time, you need to be casting your awareness over your body and releasing any tension you find. Relaxed body is vital. When I get to the bottom of the stairs, there is a door. Beyond the door is . . . well, whatever really. I used to say 'my imagination' or 'my unconscious'. Lately I say 'the unknown'.

You are also going to need to feel safe, and have a lot of trust and surrender. If you aren't giving yourself up, you aren't going to do it. Let go.

the other aspect is how you record what you find. you can have the experience and then write it afterwards, or you can try to write it as it happens. if you do it while it happens you should experiment a lot with how you sit down and where and what you use to write. if you use a keyboard for instance you will need to get good at typing with your eyes closed. alternating between

lower case for what you say
AND CAPS LOCK FOR YOUR REPLY

can also make things easier to examine afterwards, though for me it's usually very fucking messy no matter what when i return.

i'll post this too. this website is fucking amazing in my opinion, but this page is relevant to the topic.

https://ryuc.info/common/creativity_perspective/language_inner_world.htm

Oh, and also, dreams: record them seriously. and a top tip for dreams is to give each dream a unique title that is descriptive or encapsulates the dream, and keep a master list of dream titles. when you have a list of dream titles you can scan them at a glance and see themes and patterns easily.

>>33688837
Active imagination or "dreaming while awake" is the process of voluntarily letting the subconcious right brain take control. This usually results in hallucinations and voices which you can interact with to engage different parts of your psyche normally inaccessible in waking consciousness. A child interacting with an imaginary friend is a perfect example. Jungle concept of active imagination was formed during the period where "channeling" and "posession" were popular methods of creative exploration. During these exercises a medium would enter a trance state through a variety of methods depending on the personality of the medium. dance, painting and meditation are all popular methods but the goal is to find the one that suits you best. Once in this trance state you simply allow yourself to act like a child and encourage the imagination. Ideally you create something while In this state in order to remember it later when in waking consciousness.

I havent read much of Jung's work. I have read a large chunk of the red book and spoken to anons here about his work. So if I say anything wrong please chalk it up to ignorance.
When i was 12 I began doing what I later found out Jung called active imagination. I was a lonely kid and began delving into my imagination, but I treated it as tho it was a real place. I dont mean that I was "playing pretend." I was simply sitting there and imagining that my "inner world" was a physical territory that I could map out. I began to let my mind create it for me spontaneously. In the process it took on a specific look and a feel, and became occupied with personalities. One of these stuck around and I could "talk" to it even in moments when I was not actively imagining my inner world. But one thing I did was write poetry. It was a bit like automatic writing where I was allowing my subconscious speak without interruption. It wrote little poems and songs and other things. It helped focus my creativity and ultimately I was capable of writing things that people really enjoyed. I almost became a writer before I wrecked it all.
Idk if this is helpful but treating the unconscious like a real space is what I found useful. Because a "space" or "landscape" can be recalled visually, which lends itself to the visual and symbolic language of the unconscious

>>33690344
>Build a meditation practice
>Strengthen visualisation skills
These are the core things that you should practice. Neville Goddard is one potential teacher that you can incorporate, but I'll recommend these two practical ways to train as well:
The first is Psalm Magic
https://www.ariels-corner.com/learn-psalm-magic

You select a problem in your life to solve, or something you wish to happen. You take a Psalm, read it out loud once. Then you read it again slowly, trying to dig for the occult meanings, reading the Psalm in a more symbolic way.
Here's an example to get a taste of it.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_id5nMFZSuY

The reason why I recommend this is because when you do this with every Psalm, you are considered an adept, or Psalm Magician (and every time you do it again, you get another degree of initiation). You should do one Psalm a day, but you don't have to do them in order, and if a Psalm calls to you, feel free to work it multiple days (the magic comes from understanding the Psalm, after all). You shouldn't rush this, but it's a pretty straightforward way of going through a magical initiation, and should take maybe half a year or so.

The other thing I recommend is the book in pic related. You can get it off Libgen. It teaches meditation/visualization for magic (under the term "psychotronics"), as well as practical experiments to prove to yourself of your power, like getting animals and people to like you, or melting clouds away.

Stuff like tarot or astral projection depends on your schedule. I think it's better to master your meditation/visualization before branching off into other things. Instead of Hemi-Sync, I'd start off with Liquid Luck, which is another meditation by the same people using the same sound technology, only it's short and focused on "manifestation" rather than astral projection.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a5kG--O7hk0

The ancient Lyrans were titans, standing 20 to 30 feet tall, from a planet much greater in size than ours. They were white-skinned, with blond hair, usually had blue eyes, and had a life span of around 2,000 years.
They were a warlike race that had not only developed technically, but were quite advanced in the use of spiritual power. They moved their warlike forces around the galaxy and used their great power to take control of many thousands of lesser-developed races.

Over the years the Lyran blood line was mixed with other civilizations, creating many different colors and races which spread throughout the galaxy.

Just as their race was at its highest peak of advancement, a huge destructive comet that became known as the Destroyer Comet found its way into the Lyran family of planets, and two-thirds of their race were killed.
The last fly past by the Destroyer was in 1680. If this is correct, it is likely that it is the comet we know as "The Great Comet of 1680": The first ever comet discovered by telescope.

Along with the destruction, their technology was wiped out, and they were unable to continue to exercise control over the great empire they had built. The great Lyran Empire had degenerated back to one planet with no technology to speak of.
They were barely able to survive and were faced with the task of rebuilding a civilization which once dominated thousands of other worlds.

After thousands of years, the Lyrans restored their society and again became a dominant force in the Galaxy. Pleiadian history documents that he Lyrans went through a series of civilizations over a period of several millions of years. It was their pattern to rise to power, begin to fight among themselves, and then degenerate into a primitive society and start all over again. On some occasions their wars were so brutal that it took millions of years for them to recover from the primitive state left by the destruction.

posts.sub: A psychic wanted to warn me, but died
posts.com:
Hey, /x/.

Today, while listening a fake psychic advertising on the radio, I remembered this story that I wanted to share with you all. I am highly curious about what could have happened.

My mom, young, before she even had me, went to a psychic to predict her future. She was an old lady, highly experienced, and supposedly she was always right. This psychic accurately predicted not only my existence, describing how I would look like (down to stuff like me having glasses), but stuff that would later happen to my mother as well, including future relationships. She also died, but this is not the psychic I speak of. (cont.)

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Later in life, after having me, my mother had a medical condition no doctor could figure out. Out of desperation, she went to another psychic, also known for being trusted, and somehow she knew exactly what my mother's condition was. She helped reassure her everything would be okay, but the moment the session ended, she decided to doublecheck something about my mom's palms.

She started asking questions about me, even if my mother had not told her I even existed in the first place. She warned her that it was "very important" that I speak to her, and that it was a confidential matter she could not discuss with her. She knew I would probably refuse, based on my skeptic nature, but told her that she would understand if I decided not to go. (cont.)

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Later, when my mother told me, I refused, calling it a bunch of horseshit. My mother went to the hospital and the psychic was right. Not only that, but some of my mom's friends had their family members die as predicted by the lady as well. Soon after, though, she passed away.

Nowadays, sometimes, I wonder what she wanted to tell me. Is there any way to know? Was it just another one of the scams people pull? But she knew stuff without my mother even saying anything, and man, I just wanna know what could've happened.

What should I do?

posts.com: perhaps try going back to the psychic?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33696073
I understand that it can be difficult to feel lonely, especially when you have been used to being surrounded by others. Solitude can be a challenging experience, but it can also be an opportunity for growth and self-discovery.

Practice mindfulness and focus on the present moment. When you are alone, it can be easy to get caught up in negative thoughts or feelings. It helps to connect with nature and spend time appreciating the beauty of the world around you.

Also, cultivate self-compassion. Be kind and understanding with yourself, and remember that it is natural to feel lonely at times. Fill those times with activities that bring you joy. Reading, writing, drawing, whatever it is that brings you a sense of accomplishment.

>Glowies
I think the basic principles for evaluating a hypothetical conspiracy apply here as much as anywhere.

The big problem with a large-scale campaign of paid shills is that it puts too many people in the loop, making leaks inevitable.
It also creates a paper-trail, which means you'd not only have those manpower requirements, but you'd have to falsify every bit of agency paper relating to what they're doing and what your department is spending money on.
And if all your high-ranking people are in on it, making the paperwork unnecessary, then that makes the loop even bigger with even more risk and leaks.
Not impossible, but increasingly difficult, and this line of thinking is how you end up concluding that one conspiracy runs the whole world (with no leaks).

Personally, I tend to assume we're dealing with fanatics from any one of the religions that label what we do as "pure evil".
Once you insert that "pure evil" label (also why I dislike the word "Demon"), you almost guarantee that there's gonna be at least a Stand-Alone Complex of isolated fanatics who sink a LOT of time into "combating us" any way they can.
And creating the impression of government persecution is certainly a tactic they would use.

>“Lord, if it’s you,” Peter replied, “tell me to come to you on the water.”

Read these excerpts carefully. As Jesus said in the first story, man can accomplish anything with God, even move mountains, so long as he truly believes it. posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
It really depends on who you are.

Some people are born or raised in such a way that they have a clean mind and few psychological problems. For them it's easy to focus and direct their mind.

Others (like how I used to be) literally live in their mind all day long, they daydream a lot and their thoughts literally control their actions and how they feel, and the worst is that they don't even realize it because they've been living like this for so long.

So I'd suggest that you just sit and observe, just sit and don't chase anything because you may be just chasing goals which are not achievable or you might be running away from harsh truths which you must first face and endure before you can move on to greater things.

Your mind is NOT you, this was a hard pill for me to take, all those thoughts which sound 100% true are just fabrications of a wild mind.

So yeah, just sit and watch, watch how your mind goes running around but don't follow it, nor make stories about it, don't try anything for there is nothing to try, just sit, your mind will come up with all crazy stuff and you will just sit there and watch it BUT without thinking "Oh I'm watching now, I'm meditating so good" for that is also thinking.

Just be the observer, and yes, with time your mind will calm down and you will be left alone or with very few thoughts, then the real "You" will start becoming clearer and that's when you can direct your focus on APing, chakras/whatever, subconscious, old forgotten memories and other things.
But you gotta first sit in silence, sit without trying to do anything. Just observe.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33633518
Monk anon here. Meditation is a tool to understand the nature of the mind. To train ourselves to see things as they really are. It's really that simple. The reason we suffer so much is because we don't understand the nature of the mind. We don't realize how conditioned we are, the conditioning is the basis for stress and anxiety. When we watch the mind for a long enough time, we begin to understand it, we begin to notice the habitual patterns. We notice how external stimuli aren't the real cause of our anger, for example. The problem isn't that something is what it is, the problem is that we don't want it to be that way, or want it to be some other way. We learn that we're actually creating our own problems when we could just let it go. We learn that we aren't our thoughts. Thoughts are just there, the problems begin when we identify with and take them personally as "these thoughts are me." Ultimately, your mind and thoughts are working against you, until you can break the conditioning and snap out of these delusions. This actually takes more work than anyone here is willing to do. Many people see "meditation" as a quick self help fix or relaxation technique, bit they won't have any meaningful or long lasting results from their efforts. Meditation has to be developed along side morality and wisdom. It's a tripod and none will work without the others. This means that probably 99.9% of people are wasting their time with meditation, because most people can't or simply won't bother with the morality and wisdom aspect. They aren't willing to let go completely.

>>3364053
For morality? Pick a religious/spiritual/occult/philosophical school of thought with a moral code that genuinely resonates with you and start living it. The Buddhist and Zoroastrian moral codes are similarly very straight forward and easy to grasp without requiring any mental gymnastics to avoid hypocrisy. Morality really isn't as complicated as modern religious culture makes it out to be. Don't harm yourself or others. Don't help others harm themselves. Provide help when requested. Don't offer help or advice when not qualified or requested. I.E.
>"love" (commit to the well being of) your neighbors
Morality in a nutshell. Buddhist and Zoroastrian moral codes break it down slightly more clearly since Christ's proverb is apparently very easy to misunderstand. Same idea though.

For wisdom? There are countless ways. This mostly just requires life experience, reflection, and empathy. Meditating daily and bringing your baseline conscious experience closer and closer to a meditative state is a slow but reliable method. You'll be well ahead of the curve if you are able to fully comprehend and live this old Buddhist proverb:
>I am a finger pointed at the moon
>do not look at me, look at the moon
The truth is everywhere in plain sight. Look for the truth in everything, not the lies in everything.

>>33648519
It's kinda strange to explain it.
Most people nowadays live in their thinking minds, they don't live in the here and now and they only live through a lens of thinking which dictates their being, they usually think about the past and the future more than the here and now.

Feeling something is an entirely different thing from thinking, you may feel fear but you may think hateful thoughts, you may feel happiness but you may think that happiness is wrong.

I used to be an over-thinking person with an overactive mind, I'd analyze anything, I'd daydream all day long e.t.c.

Turning off my mind was scary for me, feeling my feelings was scary for me, I hated feeling anything (be it happiness, fear, sorrow) because I thought that I couldn't handle those feelings.

I remember when I began meditating, I was focusing on my breath but most of the time I was just thinking about my breath or me about focusing on the breath, or I was thinking about the feelings my breath left on my body, it took me some time to just FEEL my breath.

I still haven't answered your question and truth be told I don't have a solid answer, the closer I can get to is this: Feeling is one of your abilities, just how thinking is, just don't try to analyze/think about feeling because that is not feeling, feeling is just feeling something, there is no "wrong" or "right" feeling. Society teaches that it's "wrong" to feel sadness or sorrow or anger, those are just thought-words that others taught you, THERE IS NO WRONG FEELING, there is only feeling.
And lastly: Feeling only happens in the here and now, so I'd say that feeling is a more "grounded" ability than thinking.

I hope what I said makes some sense, if not ask me again.

Meditate on what's in front of you at any given time, "meditation" is not an act but more like a mode of being in which you accept and receive anything which is in front of you at that momment.

In the meditative state you don't want to escape, analyze, change something or think - but at the same time you are NOT making an effort to block all the analyzation, need to leave, thoughts and wants you may have.

You are the ultimate observer of reality, you observe and accept anything: from blissful states to horrible feelings and pain.

That is the meditative state, and yes, you can be meditative while "doing" things.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I'm late to the party but here's what you do. Sit crossed legged or in a chair with your back straight. Put your attention gently on the breath. Don't intensely force your attention to stay on it. Eventually you will notice your mind is wandering. Take a brief moment to acknowledge this and return your attention to the breath. If it helps, you can mentally says "in" and "out" as you breathe in and out, or "beginning" and "end" to mark the beginning and end of each in and out breath.

This is the starting technique in >>33643926 which I also highly recommend reading.

>lay on bed or sofa (the comfiest the better)

>prepared my mind with breathing exercises
>repeat at least 3 times
>7 seconds to expulse air from lungs
>7 seconds holding empty lungs
>7 seconds inhaling air
>7 seconds holding air inside lungs while flexing
>repeat again when I want to clear my mind

then advanced to
>playing little games of focusing on something for as long I can (watching a dot in my mind and trying to only think about it, a stopwatch makes funnier)
>played with impossible physical scenarios (a cup made from polystyrene with a hole in the bottom that does not leak water)
>slowed parts of musical tracks with my imagination
>mixed food flavors to create new flavors

posts.com:
There appears to be a lot of confusion on the meaning of meditation--a synonym for thinking. What I will relate here is that you're not thinking, you're trying to reach an altered state of consciousness for some reason, to astral project, to think clearer, or to attain mediumship, all of which come at once with the proper mindset and form of meditation. I will not conver energy work here, but if you do sets of 108 Om chants when you wake up you'll start to 'feel' energy, some would say yin and yang chi

Proper meditation--which I've simply called theurgy or theurgic meditation for some time now--has one purpose, to forget about the world around you and go inward. I will tell you what it feels like and how to get there.

It feels like:
>numbed hands/feet
>a spinning of the head in a clockwise/c-clockwise rotation, later turning into a swimming feeling even if laying down
seeing colors
>hearing a low rumbling sound (after extended periods
>a pressure between the eyebrows or any other centre of chakra in the body
>heartrate of 45BPM, possibly lower or higher depending on cardio and body type, and position
>and many more things I won't mention here for brevity

How to attain the above sensations

>total darkness or close to it
>breathe in through the nose, out through the mouth for intervals of 4-8 seconds, (shoot lower because as your heartrate slows so does your breathing
>remain totally still, even if you itch, it will pass.
>lay down, or otherwise be comfortable enough to stay that way for an hour or two (after while you lose the sense of time
>focus on your breathing
>roll your eyes up
>focus on whatever you wish, 3rd eye/pineal gland is my go-to
>be emotionally undisturbed, if anxiety has ahold of you go take a walk.

I can't think of much more anons, but after awhile some amazing things will start to happen if you do Om chants every morning and perform this and other mindfullness exercises of your choice before bed. Read Your Psychic Powers & How To Develop Them.

>>33614598
This is the basis of the meditative state.

People will try to put labels on it, analyze it e.t.c. but the basis of our existence is awareness - that something is looking at something else.

So yes, just sit/walk/work and observe without caring what you are observing, yes, invading thoughts from that awkward social experience a few days ago will come but don't "push it away because it's not necessary now" for you just created more thoughts, nor make a "commitment to make no more thoughts" because you just made more thoughts. Everything is worthy of your observing.

Let all thoughts, feelings and pain come, for they are all yours and you are them, you are the eternal limitless observer, yes some thoughts and memories will be painful like that time your father was mean to you or that time that girl cheated on you - but stay there and endure it, don't act, yes the voice will tell you "NO YOU HAVE TO ACT THEY ARE ATTACKING YOU" but don't, just sit and feel the feeling, endure it, don't put words on it, you just remembered how to feel again without thinking about what you're feeling....

After some sits the thoughts will be less and less, reducing the usage of recreational screen time will speed this process up. Now your sits will be mainly you feeling more instead of thinking...

I hope what I said makes some sense.

You can focus on anything you want but in the end of the day the end result is the same: You are a calm, silent observer which watches, and usually the breath becomes non-existent in deep meditation, it will be like you're not breathing at all.

I don't know why but I personally don't prefer focusing on the breath, maybe because it involves a story that it will "ground you once your mind wanders" or that it's a "vehicle to take you deeper into concentration" and people sit and make it a struggle to avoid thoughts and rush back to the breath.

Maybe it would be more beneficial if someone just watched the whole process of focusing on the breath and how invading thoughts are a normal part of the process and maybe not even label them as "invading", for in the end all reality is one big thing to accept and observe.

Meditation is about accepting the moment, even if that moment is you being dragged away in thousand of thoughts and being furious because "you lost your focus again", so yeah sit and watch your breath or whatever and just feel that moment of you watching, maybe also watch how you want to "achieve" or how you think that "watching the breath is the correct way heheh I found it", just sit and watch, become the ultimate watcher - but no need to become for you already are you just have to realize it.

Words are so meaningless.

posts.com:
Hey /x/, /p/ here and I have something you might be interested in. I went out shooting photos on Christmas eve. Yesterday I was reviewing the images and I found captured this image while in a park around midnight on Christmas Eve at exactly 11:35:55 pm according the the exif data from the raw file (I can post a screen cap if you like). Right as I pressed the shutterI heard a noise like footsteps behind me (homeless people sometimes camp in the park), so I moved causing the motion blur in the photo. Of course no one behind me. But in the photo there appears to be two figures in front of me which I could not see. When I first saw this I assumed it must be house lights as behind the tree and lamp is a fence and some houses. But upon examing the next photo I have (which I will post) taken at 11:35:41 pm, just 14 seconds earlier there is one light source, but it is no where near region of the photo where the two 'entities' can be seen (try lining up the tree in each photo and the position of the lamp post). The photos have been edited for clarity and to convert them into a postable format, but have not in any other way been cropped or altered.

We experience and perceive reality in different ways, obviously. A person who was raised in a tight knit family has grown use to functioning best with family units / tribes. Some people have grown use to isolation and function perfectly well on their own. Some people need a few very close friends or companions in order to feel stable and fulfilled, some people need heaps of attention and interactions on the other hand. As you know, we're naturally social creatures and we endure a lot in this reality, so being able to live in symbiosis with other humans is vital for many. Love is the most profound and divine, ascended aspect we can feel, share and harbor... so it's not unrealistic to value the significance of love. I don't think you're FUCKED if you're single. And I don't think you necessarily need to have children just so you can feel loved, but it's pretty imperative to establish loving bonds with others and aim to nurture those bonds throughout your entire life. We should always work towards developing self compassion, understanding and love as well.. people who live in states of hatred, guilt, fear, shame and insecurity tend to stagnate and bury themselves in detrimental pits. Judge yourself and others fairly, feel God's love, grow yourself and learn to feel love for others despite their own pitfalls and struggles. It really is the most eternal feeling.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33691984
A bunch of different guys.

Saint Nicholas was the Greek bishop that gave gifts to children on Dec 6th. but Martin Luther moved that holiday to Christmas and made a single holiday out of it. Nicholas rides a while horse, has a black servant, and a enslaved troll that punishes bad kids.

English, French, and sometimes Norway, he is Father Christmas, or the Holly King. He rides a yule goat, and is likely based on Odin.

Finland has Joulupukki who is a goat man in a red suit that rides in a sleigh pulled by a reindeer. Does the same stuff but kids are scared of the sight of him.

Russia, Estonia, Mongolia, Romania, Bulgaria, Belarus, Armenia, and Turkey has Grandfather Frost, who travels with his granddaughter, wears a white leather coat, is skinny, and is a wizard that conjures blizzards, who is based on a local slavic deity of winter and the longer night in winter.

You can express your last dreams, your attempts and ask anything about it

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

>>33686943
1. Get on a good sleep schedule, 8 hours a night.
2. When you awake from a dream, lay still and do not move. Focus all your energy on remembering every detail of the dream.
3. Write down the dreams in a way you feel comfortable that will allow you to identify common themes.
4. Pay attention to these commons themes and try to find waking similarities to them.
5. Develop reality checks based off of those similarities. Make it become second nature/muscle memory to constantly check to see if you're dreaming based off of those dream/reality similarities.
6. You will begin to notice these things in your dreams and will start to question if you are dreaming while you are in fact dreaming.
7. Once you realize you are fully conscious while you are dreaming, remain calm. Spin in place and perform simple tasks with your mind to solidify your lucidity in your dream. (Turn lights off and on, move small objects, try to read text or clocks, etc)
8. Remain calm. Spin in place again if you have to. Later you can use this practice to change your dream setting.
9. Go slowly. Do not immediately try to materialize a girl to have sex with or fly or whatever your wildest fantasy you want to act out is. Be consistent with all steps even after you begin to frequently achieve lucidity.
10. Learn to flow with the dreams while controlling them with subtlety. Enjoy them, learn from them. Learn from the people you can speak with. Learn ways to go further, deeper. Don't overthink or over analyze.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33687689
>how long does all this take?
That depends entirely on your commitment to keeping a dream journal. A lot of people, especially 99% of the total faggots that frequent /x/ now, will say this is gay and stupid. These people have no, do not and will never become lucid in a dream. The dream journal is possibly the most important practice to keep to become a consistent lucid dreamer. It's perhaps more important than maintaining a good sleep schedule to allow your brain to get into those good sleep cycles. You absolutely must focus and remember your dreams in as much detail as you can in order to find the common themes and instances that can help you trigger reality checks which will result in you becoming lucid.
You can get an app, or just keep a notebook next to your bed; whatever.
>what do i write down?
First, just focus on the dream. The smallest amount of movement or other thoughts will fire neurons in your brain and immediately make you start forgetting the dream. Even opening your eyes while lying still is enough to make your brain fire and forget. Just lay still and replay the dream and burn it into your memory. As much detail as possible. Then, write it down. It will take some time to build up a good library of dreams before you can start noticing common themes and weird instances you can use as trigger points for reality checks.

>>33688064
Astrology is a science heavily dependant upon philosophy. The practitioner must be both deeply intelligent and wise---and very few humans are, "astrologers" not excepted.

Astrology as practiced today is extremely ossified and dependant upon "tradition" which means whatever was written about it in the past, both distant and not so distant, especially when the contemporary astrologer is a woman. The practice is severely ahistorical in that it is divorced from exactly who said what about which meanings and how conceptions of these meanings developed over time. Everything ever written is usually received as is and repeated without question under the assumption it is absolutely correct. This forms a game of telephone where various kinds of information stripping (i.e. simplifications, generalizations, and so on) made for specific contexts by otherwise learned researchers got taken up by less discerning followers and brought down as dogma to the popular consciousness.

In other words, really smart people of the past had themselves erased even from the footnotes and bibliographies of less smart successors who misunderstand the nature of astrology as an interpretive science where meaning must be discovered by way of expansive, intense, deep analysis and cross-reference. It's a symptom of scientism where "the science is settled" with respect to astrology, and you know what intellectual landscape results from this.

Ultimately, you're reading a lot of people who only have a faint clue of the truth.

Air = Mental acuity/Entertaining
Earth = Traditional/Stability
Water = Emotions/creativity
Fire = Passion/Charming

Most famous people are Fire/Air. A lot of painters and artists are Water/Fire. Earth/Fire make good businessmen and generals.

Inversely, they are void of their opposites.

Air = Unstable/Disloyal
Earth = By the book/Boring
Water = Dispassionate(depressive)/Myopic
Fire = Unempathetic/Aggressive

I'm barely scratching the surface as the partner signs (Air/Fire or Water/Earth) share a lot of things with one another, and tangentially opposite signs (Earth/Fire or Air/Water) share almost opposite elements with one another.

Fire is known to be passionate, headstrong, driven, adventurous, bold, attention-seeking, thrill-seeking, and very head first into things. If paired with heavy water (sometimes earth) signs then someone with a fire sun/ascendant can become exceptionally creative.

To explain your Midheaven:
Sun semi-sextile Midheaven means these two placements traditionally have issues working together and needs to be worked on. This makes sense because Gemini rules Mercury which is—you guessed it—communication.

Venus Quintile Gemini. Quintiles detail a talent or potential not necessarily indicated by major aspects. This degree places emphasis on purposeful manifestation of ones talents. Venus rules social interaction but most importantly romance (Usually not in the traditional sense of carnal romance but of finding something romantic, like romanticizing the happiness of a caterpillar joyfully munching on a leaf).

Mars sesquare midheaven. Issues with communication are a massive conflict you'd prefer to ignore and it doesn't go away easily.

Jupiter Semi-square Midheaven is a minor negative aspect that isn't too serious. Basically your communication had issues or hiccups but they didn't result in permanent negative outcomes that effected your luck or fortune.

This one is fun, Uranus trine Midheaven. You speak/write in a unique manner but people like it somehow (or it ends up benefiting you in career).

Lastly, Neptune Sesquare Midheaven. Mind tricks negatively impact your ability to work. Might be delusions of self-doubt, mental, illness, or things of this nature which impact your ability to work negatively.
