There are few astrology websites I haven't read through. Most of them give basic bitch descriptions that fail to hone in on the precise essence of what placements mean.
As a rule of thumb, if the site uses actors and musicians as examples, then it's garbage. If it only provides you three paragraphs at most of material for the placement in question, then it's not good.
If they exhibit any bluepilled understanding of the world (eebil nazis and hitler, Michelle is a woman, the social justice movement is a good thing, etc.), then you're very likely in for make-believe trash.

Alwaysastrology specifically is kind of wonky. The descriptions are weird. They're worth considering but it's not a end-all-be-all source.
Cafeastrology has the taint of pop astrology on it and also commits the sin of brevity.
Astro is just a chart maker and ephemeris library with unrelated articles on assorted astrological topics you may or may not come across in web searches.
Reliability is very hard to find.

I use astrologyking for aspect information a lot of the time, but the descriptions are too short and seem to lean toward fellating the reader rather than straightshooting.

nta but they responded with an explanation.

Cardinal signs (Libra, Aries, Capricorn, Cancer) are all the initiators, the spark, the beginning drive. The ones in motion who get things done.

Fixed signs (Aquarius, Leo, Scorpio, Taurus) are all rooted and unmoved. The ones who stay and place and are stubborn.

Mutable signs (Gemini, Sagittarius, Pisces, Virgo) are all mediators. They're usually passive or quick to change and viewed as unreliable.

The words "Muted" and "Fixed" are both quite literal in their interpretation. Something that is "Muted" is silenced. Something that is "Fixed" will not move. Something that is "Cardinal" stands at the front and is leading.

Fixed signs

Modalities have to do with the sign's position depending on the season. Aries - Cardinal, Taurus - Fixed, Gemini - Mutable, Cancer - Cardinal, and so on and so forth. Although its a good question as to why the system was made like this in the first place, astrology is an inductive system. So the ancients made the observations and start systemizing it in this (kind of arbitrary seeming) way.

Look at the water signs or the other 3 elements and how they make people behave. Planets in scorpio causes one to have a certain behavioral pattern, pisces has another and cancer has another. They look at the other signs, aquarius is stubborn and fixed, gemini is all over the place, libra is generally balanced all things considered. Combine these observations with the order and position of the signs in the chart and you have the cardinal, fixed and mutable signs system. Pattern recognition, really.

over your lifetime, liberation of the soul.
1nd is possible but not immediate. 2rd requires diligence and willingness to abandon previous beliefs (it's what Jung did throughout his life, and why his work is so important since he managed to write it down.)
liberation of your soul (breaking the soul cycle) requires to not harm yourself and live your entire life with truth, to eliminate lies amongst what Buddha has taught, He has said and written to guide people to this ultimate truth.

to answer OP, i have always felt that all the suffering and pain merely exists in a "realm" of everything. no matter how integral it may feel, it is never "You". it is never your "Self". any consciousness, state of thought, feeling, etc. is never what you truly are. existence has multiple layers, depths and facets, pain is one of them. there are multiple states of existence/consciousnesses as Buddha explained. suffering is an integral part of material reality. incarnation in this world is to learn to walk a path through every "layer". the end is the liberation of your soul. everyone is on a different step, mostly. that's why it's difficult to communicate the angst you may feel since not everyone has the same level of depth in their journey.
this is mostly rambling but i've always felt the same way as you regarding pain in general. i hope your holidays are peaceful.

>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.
•Look for posts to determine if there's an active reader, what's needed and before posting, check if they finished reading already.
•Posting the gender of the people involved can help you get your query answered accurately.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.
•Be polite.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
My understanding is that there is only one reality and so there is no real difference between the two from from the absolute, nondual level. When you experience reality directly and make break through the ego you merge with the Absolute.

That being said, from the relative level that we find ourselves as unrealized beings there is a difference. The difference is primarily in theurgy, in effective practices to get you to the goal. In the West there is reason to believe that the deepest esoteric practices for attaining the goal have been lost - or are so secret that they're basically lost.

In the East there are still unbroken lineages stretching back for millenia with practical and efficient systems for attaining to the divine. In my experience Buddhism is the most effective.

>>33682847

Speaking of Buddhism, the highest attainment is nibbana.

But it is almost impossible to characterize since
it lacks any defining characteristic or commonality with the whole of samsara.

So it can only be defined in terms of negation,
and since the highest attainments also clear the delusion of duality, it brings only an approximation :

Buddhist and the suttas however give some attributes :

unbecome and non conditionnal
signless (lacking name and form)

from it we can derive that it is probably timeless
from a western perspective, since there is neither cause and effect here, its stable.

it is peaceful.

Even the Buddha noted its ultimate subtelty.

It is above the attainments of neither perception nor non perception
and the attainment of cessation of perception and feelings.
In MCTB, fruition (experience of nibbana) is only performed through what happens before it (the door process leading to it) and what happens when samsara 'resumes'.
It is said that the afterglow and door processes are different for the mentioned two attainments and fruition. As for the experience of fruition, he says in MCTB that it's like video frames edited from a movie. Seems like nothingness but it could be also that it is impossible to process in samsara since it is completely alien to it.
It is probably worth attaining since the fruits of the path (appreciation of samsara turns in a whole different and positive experience)
Before englightenment it looks and feel scary (close to nothingness) because of the hindrances, then after the 5 factors leading to rebirth are severed, it is no more the case.
I would like to really dig into what other enlightened beings up to the arahant stages tell of the experience of fruition, I think i'll have to check the references in MCTB. if any of you have good leads, I am eager to read them.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Fought for Napoleon in his Russian campaign. Actually got to meet him once, as I was the best rider in my unit and was ordered to deliver the news to his camp. The actual news was either that the our left artillery nest was overran but we managed to push the Russians back or that we overran the Russian's far left artillery nest and captured their cannons that were left operational. When winter hit and the army as retreating, I got separated from my group when we were looking for supplies at an abandoned barn cellar. Cossacks tracked us down and chased us. We all ran like mad and I darted to the woods by a Cossack saber cut my back and I fell unable to move on the snow. The attack didn't kill me but it was the blood loss and exposure that finally got me. It felt like I was going to sleep. The whole time in winter I just longed to return home to Italy with my family but I guess I never got to go back home to mama and maybe is the reason I like Italy so much in this life.

This all came to me in dreams. Is there any other way to find more info about this past life or another?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: I have this recurring dream where I am convinced it's visions from a past life. I was a bit younger than I am now. I was probably around 16 or 17 in this dream. Anyway it took place in this old looking city. Like there were Greek style pillars in the front of large baroque and Victorian Era buildings with small walled yards and the trucks were very old looking and parts of the city were abandoned. I was some sort of soldier with a dog. My job was to walk around check on the streets that were abandoned and make sure nobody was there. Sometimes I'd see other soldiers kinda just loitering or going on their own patrols. There was this really fucking bad tension everywhere and me and the other soldiers had this fear of our officers. We stayed in what kinda looked like a trailer park about the size of a football field but the trailers were more like prefab box like buildings made of metal and were lined up in neat orderly rows and there was this massive ditch dug around the whole compound with tall razor wire and towers guarding it. In the center of it there was this concrete bunker thing where I was NOT SUPPOSED TO GO INTO and the officer inside got very angry if I even looked at it. There were always trucks and jeeps coming through. One night I have this dream where I hear sirens. They sounded so fucking awful I was sweating and the other few soldiers were sort of panicking as they hopped into their trucks and drove to their posts. It was about before sunset when this happened. I remember not having a truck and i just had my dog and I was really fucking scared and tried walking to the city to get to my post when suddenly things started exploding. Like the ground would randomly fucking explode sending huge chunks of dirt crashing down and shooting small bits of rock everywhere that stung even if you stood a block away. Of course the sirens were going off causing more chaos. I eventually ran through a wooded area and found some soldiers sorta deserting and cowering.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: All I remember are bottomless test chambers and owning a superhuman body to endure endless testing. The body was the prototype product. It was voluntary too.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33695154
PART 2

So I see these soldiers and they begin laughing at me saying I'm just young and dumb and if I was smart I would desert also. Of course I could barely hear them and decided to just go to my post. I'd be safer with the rest of my team right? I took the shortcut through a wooded area and went to this cemetery. Big. Fucking. Mistake. I remember this shit when I woke up from the dream and it still bothers the shit out of me when I think of how bad it was. The ground in the cemetery exploded, sending bones and huge chunks of black earth into the sky sending chunks of corpses everywhere and I remember being so scared I literally shit myself when I saw a small jeep with the officer in it. He was with 2 other soldiers and he saw me and look surprised. He quickly grabbed me and took me with him quickly into the city where he said I would wait by a train and protect those trying to leave. He said we were being attacked and that the leaders should have known better than to send the main force away. He was very pissed off about the whole deal. I eventually got dropped off into the city where this mob of rich people were crammed into this weird looking metal artsy looking pavilion waiting for a train. Covered trucks were just unloading crying people and one of them saw me and started a riot almost. They were screaming at me and blaming my army for the attacks and one even laid this dead little girl at my feet. I remember her bloated blue corpse vividly and felt disgusted as the father kept screaming in my face and his wife stood by and wept. He kept screaming when the train was coming but I had no radio and didn't know. I tried calling the crowd when this sickening disgusting green light lit up the avenue and we looked up. It looked like a shooting star but fell very slowly and it was a very sickly green. When it was halfway to the ground there was this huge BOOOOM and half the people just dropped and I fell feeling my lungs quit working.

It's a title of a short story by Harlan Elison "I have no mouth and I must scream".
It tells a story about a world where AI supercomputer gained consciousness, realized it will exists for all eternity and decided to get revenge on humans. It killed everyone but ~5 people, kept them immortal and tortured them for thousands of years. Story ends when one guy manages to kill the rest of the living people, thus preventing the AI Supercomputer from having more fun. AI turns the guy into a slime which is unable to hurt itself, so AI can torture that guy for all eternity.

It's well written and short, give it a go.

Existence as we know it is a great probability curve, a cloud of all possibilities existing simultaneously in a near-infinite multiverse. Time also functions the same way - our brains function as quantum wave-collapsers in this sense, converting information from that cloud into a subjective experience, with many other influences dictating our flow of time and connecting us into a singular timeline, etc.

The future has already happened, every variation of it. That's how time travel is indeed possible, into the past or future. I imagine there should theoretically be technology capable of "locking" two distinct locations in the multiverse, or anchoring them to this one so they can always return.

Not OP, or anyone being discussed.

But has anyone here heard of some kind of mountain/hil energy theory?

I grew up wayyyy out in the middle of nowhere, Alaska. In the bush. Long story short...there was a old mad scientist kind of guy who lives close by, up on a hill. I think he wrote a bunch of his theories and ideas down, he used to keep moose fetuses in jars and such.

Anyways, last time he was there was around 20-25 years ago. He's probably dead...never coming back around here anyways. His house is out far enough that there is basically no one who would have raised his work and treasures so far...just one native guy in the area. He already stole a snow machine from the place but he's also the kind of guy to find papers or tapes or theories worthless...so I feel like whatever was left there is still there.

I'm going to check it out wirhba camera and flashlight this next summer, make a YouTube channel about it. See if I find anything neat.

Anyone interested in hearing more now or when I make the trip? It's only a mile or two from my cabin but it's up the hill, through a jungle of devils clubs and uncut brush.

We are all approaching minor telepathy pretty quickly.
The basics don't feel like much, really.
If you have meditated and you have cleared your mind before, and you know what it's like to have your thoughts stop for a period of time,
and then have another thought start again later,
then you know sort of what it's like to read someone else's mind, to some extent.

Whether a conversation is possible or how long conversations can go on for when we are so inundated with poison thoughts and lifestyle I don't really know,
but if you operate relatively frequently from a place of "no thoughts" it is not uncommon to have someone else's thought appear in your head as if it's your own.

This might be basic mirror neuron level telepathy, and if it is, it would mean that the neurons firing in your head in mirror fashion wouldn't be a direct copy of someone else's neurons, just whichever ones you happen to have that are similar enough to be triggered. Mirror neurons, if you train your empathy, can leave you feeling the feelings and physical pains/tension of another person. Say you are watching someone sing opera...if you are open and available to your mirror neurons, they will create the sensations in your body that the other persons body is going through.

Obviously it's not their body, so it's your version of what they are experiencing.
If you translate this over to mirror neuron style "picking up" of other peoples thoughts, from an empty, thoughtless state,
they generate in your head as if they were your own.
This can make it difficult to know if they are yours, or someone else's, but there are tells. Sometimes they are about things that don't concern you, or they have emotional depth about a subject that you don't actually feel that emotion for.

Semi-schizo, but an actual answer?

The American Military, and a couple of European Universities, have done qualifiable experiments into Telepathy and more or less:
Telepathy can be used to communicate spoken words, *mental images, and emotional feelings. How receiving this content "feels" varies wildly depending on the persons disposition and relationships: some people view telepathy as an extremely opening, liberating, and spiritually rewarding experiences, while others experience telepathy as a deeply invasive and horrible experience where privacy effectively does not exist. This can also cause 'bouts of paranoia as sometimes when someone experiences telepathy they develop the fear that their thoughts are never safe again.
*This is more literal. By that I mean if you telepathically communicate in Spanish and your partner doesn't understand Spanish the telepathy won't change that. Likewise, mental images aren't made sharper or more 'objective'. If somebody shares an image it'll still be depended on a persons mental acuity.

Sort of. In a conversation you can lie, allude to things, you can plant a lot of social nuances or what have you in a conversation and purposefully plan it out.

posts.name: Poncho PC
posts.com:
>ITT: anons post pictures of trips to cemeteries and interesting paranormal sites

Post photos of your local cemeteries. A few suggestions though:

1) Respect the dead. Don't step/lean on markers. Try to pick up trash whenever possible. If its close to a marker assume its an offering and leave it be. It should go without saying, don't take anything. It belongs to the deceased and it is punishable by imprisonment.

2) Respect the living. People are grieving, don't take photos of them intentionally. If a mourner approaches, put the camera down and clear out. Come back later if you wish after they are gone.

3) Do not trespass. Its locked for a reason. Keep out.

Use your best judgement as a rule of thumb

Some recommendations:

1) Boots. It gets muddy in some areas. Don't wear anything you're not ready to get soiled.

2) Tripod. It makes for taking excellent panning shots, still videos and self photos.

3) Water. Running around a cemetery all morning is cause for dehydration.

4) Get there as soon as it opens. In the early morning there are few to no people which will be best for photographs and not to inconvenience anyone.

5) Take photos of weird and interesting things you notice. Report back

Have fun

Previous thread: http://archive.4plebs.org/x/thread/33637838/#33637838

Yes, yes. Both of you please go take pics. That'd be great. Something to keep in mind so you don't end up with a thread full of upside down or sideways photos:

+ Camera phones store orientation in .exif
+ 4chan(nel) strips .exif
+ pics end up being posted oriented weird ways

One Solution: Open pics in an editor ( M$Paint actually works great for this ) save the pic oriented correctly, post that pic. - since M$Paint doesn't use .exif for orientation, 4chan(nel) posts pic correctly

>"nah foo! i wanna talk to you!"
>fuck here we go

Posting a few replies! I’m a /his/ YouTuber, I love visiting graves. Will start with some of my better ones.

There’s a story here, more heartbreaking every time I tell it.
>Polish soldiers sent to British hospitals in WWII
>Some of them develop PTSD, kept in this asylum
>After the war, they are not sent back to Poland, because the communist, Soviet backed government would kill them or send them to work camps
>Local mental institute (now classy apartments for wealthy weekenders from London) has a policy of just letting them languish there until they fucking die
>A few of them are left in the 1990s, authorities find their families in a now-free Poland
>None of the families want a reunion, saying “dad died decades ago”
>Iron cross gravestones here were scrapped in the 70s by the hospital

Rest in peace, Polish heroes

>>33691981
https://youtu.be/mwpdWZJCJyk
Hugh Moon is a weird local character, surprised there’s no ghost stories about him. He was an early bodyguard of Joseph Smith (PBUH) who came to Utah with Brigham Young, whom he seems to have disliked.

Briggy sent some men to south Utah to fend off and preach to Indians, and he ordered Hugh to go with them. Hugh said no, and went to live in a remote cabin just north of the territorial border. A lot of bodyguards at the time were also acting as vigilantes, so it fits the image I have as head canon of a man fleeing from his shady past.

When he died, he asked to be buried “in Zion,” down in Utah. Back in those days, no clear survey of the Utah Idaho border was done. The end result is his burial, 10 feet too far north of Utah. Sadly, another local woman - wanting to be buried in Utah, asked for the same. Thinking that Hugh was in Zion, they buried her just south of him… 5 feet north of the border.

posts.name: Poncho PC
posts.com:
>ITT: anons post pictures of trips to cemeteries and interesting paranormal sites

Welcome to Grave /x/plorers General

Post photos of your local cemeteries and paranormal sites. A few suggestions though:

1) Respect the dead. Don't step/lean on markers. Try to pick up trash whenever possible. If its close to a marker assume its an offering and leave it be. It should go without saying, don't take anything. It belongs to the deceased and it is punishable by imprisonment.
2) Respect the living. People are grieving, don't take photos of them intentionally. If a mourner approaches, put the camera down and clear out. Come back later if you wish after they are gone.
3) Do not trespass. Its locked for a reason. Keep out.
4) Do not destroy or break anything in an attempt to gain access/take a photo. Maintenece crews will find out and lock down the area which will ruin it for future investigators.

Use your best judgement as a rule of thumb

Some recommendations:

1) Boots and old/rugged clothes. You might be climbing fences and walking through muddy areas. Don't wear anything you're not ready to get soiled or tear.
2) Tripod. It makes for taking excellent panning shots, still videos and self photos.
3) Water. Running around a cemetery all morning is cause for dehydration. Maybe a light snack.
4) Get there as soon as it opens. In the early morning there are few to no people which will be best for photographs and not to inconvenience anyone.
5) Take photos of weird and interesting things you notice. Report back

>But I dont have any paranormal sites or graveyards in my area

The potential for the paranormal to exist is everywhere. Even if its tied to your cities history like an accident or tragedy, or a long walk innawoods alone, youre bound to find something /x/ related

Previous thread: http://archive.4plebs.org/x/thread/33637838/#33637838

Have fun

>Something to keep in mind so you don't end up with a thread full of upside down or sideways photos:

+ Camera phones store orientation in .exif
+ 4chan(nel) strips .exif
+ pics end up being posted oriented weird ways

One Solution: Open pics in an editor ( M$Paint actually works great for this ) save the pic oriented correctly, post that pic. - since M$Paint doesn't use .exif for orientation, 4chan(nel) posts pic correctly
Antoher solution: Always take video and photographs in the horozontal mode of your camera phone

Being an antediluvian entity, every single thing we know about him comes through oral tradition over the course of at least 10000 years.
The Sumerian source (kings list) marks Ziusudra as the last antediluvian king, and that he reigned for almost 13000 years. Doesn't mean that's how long he lived of course, Ziusudra may well have lived for centuries or millennia before ever taking the throne of Shuruppak.

In the context of Nephilim and fallen angels, this wouldn't even be out of place.
Noach was noted as a very tall man who seemed to glow light from his body.
Ziusudra was noted as being on the Council of Kings on equal footing with the god Enlil.
Deucalion was the son of Prometheus, meaning he was by definition either a god himself, or a demigod.
And what binds these names? They all built the Ark and saved Man from the Great Flood.
Perhaps that's what Prometheus taught his son. The Sumerian tablet on Ziusudra misses a lot of information, it doesn't mention who told Ziusudra to do it.
Other tablets mention Enki told Atrahasis to do it, but Enki is just another name for the same god.
If Prometheus taught his son how to build the Ark, Enlil would have his vengeance on him.
One might wonder then if Zeus/Iupiter was Enlil. Both Greek and Roman myth tell the tale of Zeus/Iupiter repeating Saturn/Cronus' mistake, which literally blew his forehead open. (Hence the Great Red Spot, it's a wound)
I wonder who inflicted it.
I do know that whoever did it became an angel and was promoted later.

>>33688273
Human species has actually only had roughly modern intelligence since about 50,000 BC.

40,000 years were spent as cavemen because the climate didn't allow for agriculture.

10,000 BC the climate warmed sufficiently that agriculture was possible. Once you have agriculture, you can give up your nomad lifestyle and build a civilisation. The surplus of food in good harvest years allows for the time to invest in technology, etc.

At first the harvests were pretty shit and it took 1000s of years of selective breeding to make good crops.

About 4000 BC, the crops became fruitful enough especially around rivers for great civilisations to thrive: Egypt, Sumeria, etc. Writing is developed about the same time which makes it much easier to accumulate knowledge and massively accelerates our development.

The rest is history.

>>33688273
>What happened at 10000 BBC?

Younger Dryas Impact happened.
Around 13,000 ago a large asteroid slammed into the atmosphere, shattered like buckshot, and rained down space debris across the world causing destruction and mayhem. The Younger Dryas was immediately responsible for several things:
-It ended the Ice Age. The Impact itself heated the atmosphere and the fires from the debris holocausted the earth's temperature to something like +6 degrees Celsius in a very short amount of time.
-The increase in global temperatures caused Pleistocene Ice to thaw and retract: diminishing the amount of available land through rising sea levels.
-Changing climate, the destruction of biomes by fire, and diminishing space from rising sea levels, caused the extinction of most Pleistocene Megafauna.

Humans had essentially not been doing anything of interest for around 190k years because there was no reason to do anything. Intelligence trivialized survival, the land was largely devoid of any meaningful competition, conditions were consistent, and food ridiculously plentiful. All of these things essentially changed after the Younger Dryas Impact and the added difficulties and challenges demanded innovation and solutions.
That's about it.

The shadow behind your projection
Finds a way to overcome
Holy, do you smell the fumes?
Your frequency is out of tune

Part the ghost from your reflection
Hallowed as its false impressions
Evaporate in morning sun
Slowly, truth takes hold of you
When innocence has left the room

Let devotion swallow you
Candid is the split
Severed from a wish come true
You manifested this
An angel drowns where pleasure lies
A tangled gaze, the great divide
Where spangled waves, Gods vengeful eyes
Wax and wane with his regrets

Against my love shall be as I am now,
With Time's injurious hand crushed and o'erworn;
When hours have drained his blood and filled his brow
With lines and wrinkles; when his youthful morn
Hath travelled on to age's steepy night;
And all those beauties whereof now he's king
Are vanishing, or vanished out of sight,
Stealing away the treasure of his spring;

Against confounding age's cruel knife,
That he shall never cut from memory
My sweet love's beauty, though my lover's life:
His beauty shall in these black lines be seen,
And they shall live, and he in them still green.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
At the age of 16 I realized the stupidity of everything I had done, and decided to
retreat to go think about the roots and causes of my actions.
The funny thing is they punished me way after the fact, when I
finally had begun to become conscious of my actions, 2 years later- when they said
it would be fun if I came back and as a result, I did, thinking that it was a
chance to make amends and to show that I had changed.
I thought it was all going to be alright, that I was just going to have some slice-of-life content
and someone to share things with occasionally.
Instead I was met with mockery of my past 14-16 year old self, indirect questions about my
opinions trying to measure me, and unprovoked attacks based in their perceptions that were not
based in factual reality.

I should have had blind trust in my opinion. It's just that when like, 20 people tell you
that you're wrong about something it becomes really hard to not doubt yourself to some extent.
I should have never tested out what they thought. I proved myself right about everything.

I was ignorant of the envy that they had for me, and the fact that most of them were self-deluded- this makes them incapable of offering any kind of valuable input.

It's so clear now. When they spoke of envy, they were referring to themselves. When they criticized faith, it was the same thing.

It's just two egos coming together to interact. They exchange emotions which are driven by personal narratives.

I hope you understand that I don't like mine and I don't respect yours, so, it's a bit hard.

I used to laugh about everything, and only do the things that brought me peace of mind. That's all I remember.
